greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primitive (aperiodic) palindromes using exactly two different symbols.
reference: M. R. Nester (1999). Mathematical investigations of some plant interaction designs. PhD Thesis. University of Queensland, Brisbane, Australia. [See A056391 for pdf file of Chap. 2]
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) seq(n)={Vec(sum(k=1, n\3, moebius(k)*2*x^(3*k)/((1 - 2*x^(2*k))*(1 - x^k)) + O(x*x^n)), -n)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 29 2019
results.author: _Marks R. Nester_
ext: Terms a(32) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 28 2019
